name: bj-exalimi
params: setvar s0, wff w0, wff w1, wff w2
body: |- wi(wex(s0, w0), wi(wal(s0, w1), wex(s0, w2)))

stmt.origin: com12(wex(s0, w0), wal(s0, w1), wex(s0, w2))

body.origin:
|- wi(wex(s0, w0), wi(wal(s0, w1), wex(s0, w2)))
-| wi(wal(s0, w1), wi(wex(s0, w0), wex(s0, w2)))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wex(s0, w0), wi(wal(s0, w1), wex(s0, w2)))
-| wi(wal(s0, w1), wi(wex(s0, w0), wex(s0, w2)))

body.origin:
|- wi(wal(s0, w1), wi(wex(s0, w0), wex(s0, w2)))
-| wi(w1, wi(w0, w2))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wex(s0, w0), wi(wal(s0, w1), wex(s0, w2)))
-| wi(w1, wi(w0, w2))

|- wi(wex(s0, w0), wi(wal(s0, w1), wex(s0, w2)))
-| wi(w0, wi(w1, w2))

comment: An inference for distributing quantifiers over a double implication. The canonical derivation from its closed form ~ bj-exalim (using ~ mpg ) has fewer essential steps, but more steps in total (yielding a longer compressed proof). (Almost) the general statement that ~ speimfw proves. (Contributed by BJ, 29-Sep-2019.)
